tit.cmt: 以仁王の王子 と解釈しました。

sen.j: 道尊（どうそん、安元元年（1175年）‐安貞2年（1228年））は、平安時代末期の皇族・僧侶。
sen.e: Doson (1175-1228) was a member of the imperial family and a monk in the end of the Heian period.
Doson (1175 - 1228) was a member of the imperial family and a monk during the end of the Heian period.
Doson (1175 - 1228) was a member of the Imperial Family and a priest during the end of the Heian period.
sen.cmt: priest, Imperial Familyと変更しました。

sen.j: 以仁王（後白河天皇第三皇子）の第二王子。
sen.e: He was the second prince of Motohito (the third prince of Emperor Goshirakawa).
He was the second prince of Motohito (the third prince of Emperor Goshirakawa).
He was the second prince of Prince Motohito (the third prince of Emperor Goshirakawa).

sen.j: 母は伊予守高階盛章の娘（一説に伊予守平教盛の娘である三位局）。
sen.e: His mother was a daughter of Moriaki TAKASHINA, Iyo no Kami (Governor of Iyo Province) (some people say that his mother was Sanmi no tsubone, a daughter of TAIRA no Motomori, Iyo no Kami).

sen.j: 北陸宮の異母弟にあたる。
sen.e: He was a half younger bother to Hokuroku no miya with a different mother.
He was the half younger bother to Hokuroku no miya by a different mother.
He was a younger paternal half-bother to Hokuroku no miya.
sen.cmt: 異母弟 の表現を統一しました。

sen.j: 若宮・安井宮ともいう。
sen.e: He was also referred to as Wakamiya or Yasui no miya.
sen.cmt: 読み方不明のため、暫定的に、安井宮→Yasui no miya と訳出しています。

sen.j: 治承4年（1180年）父以仁王の挙兵に際して平家に捕らえられる。
sen.e: He was captured by the Taira family when his father, Motohito rose in arms in 1180,
He was captured by the Taira family when his father, Motohito rose in arms in 1180,
He was captured by the Taira family when his father, Prince Motohito rose in arms in 1180.

sen.j: その後、宮の処置をめぐっては、平清盛と平宗盛の間で紛糾したという。
sen.e: It is said that a dispute between Taira no Kiyomori and TAIRA no Munemori occurred to decide how Doson would be treated.

sen.j: 旧皇族（以仁王は平家の圧力で「源以光」として臣籍降下させられていた）という出自もあり、死罪に処するわけにもいかず、結局仁和寺において出家させることとなった。
sen.e: Since he was a member of the former imperial family (Motohito was forced to be demoted to a subject as `MINAMOTO no Mochihito' by the Taira clan), applying a death penalty to him was not possible; after all, it was concluded that he would become a priest and enter Ninna-ji Temple.

sen.j: 殷富門院亮子内親王（後白河天皇第一皇女）は自らの御所を仏寺とした蓮華光院に道尊を引き取り養育した
sen.e: Inpumonin Imperial Princess Ryoshi (the first princess of Emperor Goshirakawa) took Doson in and bring up in Rengeko-in Temple that was originally her home.

sen.j: このことから、同院の開基は道尊とされた。
sen.e: From this, the founder of the temple was said to be Doson.

sen.j: 建久4年（1193年）一身亜闍梨に補された。
sen.e: In 1193, he was appointed to an isshin-ajari (a special class of the teaching priests, who are noble and permitted to play role of ajari).

sen.e: In May 1204, he was appointed to a hoin (the highest rank among Buddhist priests), and then he was appointed to a gon no sojo (a highest ranking priest, next to a sojo) in December.

sen.e: In August 1228, he passed away.

sen.j: 土御門天皇・順徳天皇・後堀河天皇の三代に渡る護持僧を務めた。
sen.e: He served as a gojiso (a priest who prays to guard the emperor) of the emperors; Emperor Gotsuchimikado, Emperor Juntoku, Emperor Gohorikawa, for three generations.
